New Records: Jonatan Clase reached base four times and hit his first career home run
Key Match Events: Toronto Blue Jays got to Richard Fitts in the fourth inning with Vladimir Guerrero doubling and coming around on a Alejandro Kirk double
Kirk drove in both runners by smacking a ball off the wall near the right-field corner
Clase hit a two-run shot in the seventh inning off Red Sox reliever Josh Winckowski
Pre-Game Insights: Toronto manager John Schneider emphasized the importance of Jonatan Clase controlling the zone
Clase's main goal is just trying to get on base, and if he can get on base, he can help his team a lot
Post-Match Reflections: Jarren Duran said he's proud of what this clubhouse was able to do and what they accomplished, and it's a good building block for the next year
Toronto manager John Schneider said he's proud of the team's win and what they accomplished
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rogers Centre roof opened shortly before first pitch
The game took two hours 31 minutes to play
Others: Blue Jays shortstop Bo Bichette was scheduled to undergo surgery Wednesday to repair his fractured right middle finger
Regular first-base coach Mark Budzinski moved across the diamond to fill in for third-base coach Carlos Febles, who underwent knee surgery on Tuesday
